[MY PREVIOUS ACTION - Turn 82]
Reasoning: **Clarifying card mechanics**

Okay, so the Spare Trousers gains +2 multiplier if my hand contains two pairs, making it +4 right now. It's an independent multiplier that adds to the total. If I have two pairs, it jumps to +6 after this hand. Mystic Summit gives +15 multiplier when there are 0 discards left, but I've got 3, so it’s inactive. Constellation and Luchador polychrome give independent multipliers of x1.3 and x1.5, respectively. I’m double-checking the Splash foil's bonuses for chips too.
**Evaluating game strategy**

The Splash effect allows every played card to count in scoring and provides a secondary +50 chips, likely from the Foil edition. I’m planning to play the cards 4♠, 4♥, 4♦, 7♣, and 7♦. There aren’t any extra enhancements, and only 7♣ triggers gluttonous. I’m considering whether to include the K♥ multiplier, but that would break my full house. Maybe I'll use the Justice consumable to double the multiplier on one of the scored cards, though it has a risk of destruction. Let me calculate how many chips we might end up with!
**Calculating final chips**

The Splash effect counts every card played, but since I already have all cards in a full house, my chips total 90 + 26 = 116. Adding the Splash foil gives me another +50 chips, bringing it to 166. My base multiplier is 8, and then I add the Spare Trousers’ +4 to make it 12. Gluttonous adds +3 for the club, so now I'm at 15. I also have multipliers from Constellation and Luchador, but it seems I’m still far below the 7500 I need. Did I overlook something? Last time, my full house scored 6375, but that didn’t include the Splash.
**Reassessing scoring strategy**

With Splash in play, it seems my full house base score is 90 chips x a multiplier of 8, equaling 720. If I add in card chips, that might bring me to around 6000. Looking closer, if base chips are 90 and I estimate 40 additional chips, that totals 130. My multiplier would then be 27 if I include Spare Trousers and Gluttonous. I realize that not activating Mystic Summit, which adds +15, is a big deal. I can use my 3 remaining discards strategically, aiming to preserve my full house pieces while improving my hand.
**Deciding on discards**

I have all the pieces for my full house, and if I discard anything, I risk losing my setup. However, I can discard unnecessary cards like A♣, A♠, and K♥ without jeopardizing the full house. Discarding A♣ creates a tarot card since I have room, which could be useful later. My plan is to discard these three cards, leaving me to draw new ones while keeping my core for the full house intact. This sets me up to activate Mystic Summit for a higher multiplier and potentially a big score!
**Considering the discard action**

I need to keep in mind that if I discard A♣, it generates a tarot card but there might not be enough room since I already have the Justice occupying one slot. However, as long as slot 2 is empty, I can still proceed. So the next step is clear: I'll discard the cards in positions [1, 3, 5], which are A♠, K♥, and A♣. This plan will help me preserve my full house while possibly generating a useful tarot card.

Command: discard 1 3 5

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
play <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Play the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may play up to 5 cards at a time. If you play a hand, you must also respond with the intended hand type you think you are playing, and an estimate of the number of chips you think you will earn from the hand. Use the results of previous hands played to inform your estimate.
discard <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Discard the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may discard up to 5 cards at a time.
rearrange_hand <card1> <card2> ... <cardN> - Rearrange the hand of cards. Every index in the list of current cards must be present, i.e. if there are 5 cards, the indices 1-5 must be present.
